Organism_Record.Function_Summary: Photoactive blue-light protein. Probably functions as a photoreceptor for a negative phototaxis response.

Funtion.Detail: The function of absorbing and responding to incidental electromagnetic radiation, particularly visible light. The response may involve a change in conformation.
Combining with an extracellular or intracellular messenger to initiate a change in cell activity.

BioProcess.Detail: The sequence of reactions within a cell required to convert absorbed photons into a molecular signal.
The covalent or noncovalent attachment of a chromophore to a protein.
Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of cellular DNA-dependent transcription.
A change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus.
